channel.title: What is the variable for skills?

item.title: What is the variable for skills?
item.dc:creator: @Jack_Bower Jack Bower
item.description:
@Jack_Bower wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:1, topic:418379”]for example
For some reason in slayer its set up like:


	public void giveTask() {
		if (c.combatLevel < 25)
			giveTask(1);
		else if (c.combatLevel >= 30 && c.combatLevel <= 60)
			giveTask(2);
		else if (c.combatLevel > 65 && c.combatLevel <= 80)
			giveTask(3);
		else if (c.combatLevel >= 122 && c.combatLevel <= 138)
			giveTask(4);

If I can change it to where it says something likeL

if (s.slayerLevel < 25)
			giveTask(1);

because if a player is 120 and his slayer level is 1 he’s going to get a task he cant do… Im not sure where to even find the variable, but if someone else knows that would be awesome :D[/quote]

I HIGHLY recommend you don’t program like this, but for a quick-fix you can simply add more conditions.

Example:

else if (c.combatLevel > ## && c.slayerLevel < ##)
	giveTask(#);

Read full topic
item.source: What is the variable for skills?

item.title: What is the variable for skills?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

for example
For some reason in slayer its set up like:


	public void giveTask() {
		if (c.combatLevel < 25)
			giveTask(1);
		else if (c.combatLevel >= 30 && c.combatLevel <= 60)
			giveTask(2);
		else if (c.combatLevel > 65 && c.combatLevel <= 80)
			giveTask(3);
		else if (c.combatLevel >= 122 && c.combatLevel <= 138)
			giveTask(4);

If I can change it to where it says something likeL

if (s.slayerLevel < 25)
			giveTask(1);

because if a player is 120 and his slayer level is 1 he’s going to get a task he cant do… Im not sure where to even find the variable, but if someone else knows that would be awesome

Read full topic
